answers.answer: yes, you should seek medical attention asap.If this is diabetes it needs to be addressed urgently as it could be life threatening.  Please go to the emergency room and tell them your symptoms and ask them to check what's going on.Then come back and let us know what happened.

question: I am a 22 year old male who runs  and stays generally active. Recently I noticed I have been feeling very lethargic and generally drained. I cut back my workouts to see if it was from going to the gym too often. That has not helped. I also have noticed my water consumption has sky-rocketed the past two days I have easily drank 20 bottles of water. Besides my hands and feet hurting the most alarming symptom came last night while I was driving I grabbed a snack at the store that included a candy bar, a bottle of water, and a bag of pretzels. Within 10 minutes of finishing my little snack I was feeling really ill and sleepy, my vision also started to go through phases of extreme blurriness along with a strong headache. I eventually pulled over at a rest stop and slept it off. What could this possibly be, and should I seek medical attention asap?
title: Alarming symptoms
